wikitext.*:
'''''Tûl Acharn!''''' was a phrase that [[Húrin]] shouted to [[Lorgan]] in [[Hithlum]] after he was released from [[Angband]] by [[Morgoth]].

== History ==
After the [[Easterlings (First Age)|Eastron]], [[Lorgan]], told [[Húrin]] to leave [[Hithlum]] and wished him ill, Húrin shouted the phrase "''Tûl Acharn''", warning Lorgan that he was not the last of the [[Edain]], regardless of his fate.<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}, pp. 253-254</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Tûl Acharn!'' is a [[Sindarin]] phrase translating to "''Vengeance comes''", and is made up of the words ''[[Tûl]]'' ("to come") and ''[[Acharn]]'' ("vengeance, an act of revenge").<ref>{{PE|Eldarin}}, pp. 166-168</ref>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
In a note, [[Christopher Tolkien]] mentions that the phrase was originally '''Tôl Acharn'''.<ref>{{WJ|Hurin}}, p. 301, Note 19</ref>
